title: Yasuo Q glitch
body: Buy infinity edge and phantom dancer. You now have 100% crit (and infinity edge passive). Yasuo's Q does not apply infinity edge passive. You can tell by the damage it deals relative to your autos. It should do more damage than your autos by a solid amount, but it does not. Notice how his Q says it applies on hit effects and obviously can crit. His Q should apply infinity edge passive, but IT DOES NOT.

replies.body:
You may want to read this part of his passive.

> [League of Legends Wikia {{champion:157}} ](http://leagueoflegends.wikia.com/wiki/Yasuo)

> INTENT: Yasuo's critical strike chance is doubled, but his critical strikes deal 90% damage, reduced to 75% damage on Steel Tempest.

I understand that. This applies to his auto attacks too... Look at the relative damage between autos and Q. Q deals 100% total physcia ldamage + 100 flat. Yet your autos STILL out damage your Q at 300 ad. --- infinity edge passive. Look for yourself.

I just played a match as yasuo, actually. At 345 AD, my Q crit on allied red buff did 945. Auto attack was hitting for 990. 

My Q damage is 100 flat plus 100% total AD, while autos are obviously 100% total ad... so my Q non crit was 445, and aa non crit is 345..
The fact that my Q is being OUT DAMAGED by my aa means that infinity edge passive is NOT correctly applying, and needs fixed.

Can you into math? Yasuo's Autoattacks deal *1.9 crit damage instead of *2.0, and his Q deals *1.75. This means that once you get enough AD to offset the Q's bonus damage, your autoattacks will outscale it.

Hell, because of the multiplicative nature of the Infinity Edge passive, the damage gap gets even more noticable. The AD you get from inherent scaling, IE, and a BT will just about get you to the threshold.
Almost positive that isn't mentioned in his kit at all. That's just what it turns out to be without IE, isn't it?
